definitions.text: a wound resulting from biting by an animal or a person
a small amount of solid food; a mouthful
examples: all they had left was a bit of bread

definitions.text: a painful wound caused by the thrust of an insect's stinger into skin
(angling) an instance of a fish taking the bait
examples: after fishing for an hour he still had not had a bite

definitions.text: wit having a sharp and caustic quality
a strong odor or taste property
the act of gripping or chewing off with the teeth and jaws
a portion removed from the whole
examples: the government's weekly bite from my paycheck

definitions.text: to grip, cut off, or tear with or as if with the teeth or jaws
examples: Gunny invariably tried to bite her

definitions.text: cause a sharp or stinging pain or discomfort
penetrate or cut, as with a knife
examples: The fork bit into the surface
A bee stung my arm yesterday
